moves.5... Ng4 6. d4: ?! Would normally expect to see Bc4
moves.8... d6 9. O-O: Qd3 first with the option of castling queenside looks more accurate.
moves.13... Kh8 14. Nd5 Bg5 15. Nxg5: White has control of open & semi open file.
moves.16... Qh5 17. Ne3: ! this is effective repositioning of the knight; will force black to exchange his main defender of the kings side
moves.20... Qe7 21. Re3: Queen will now be driven to a weaker square
moves.21... Qd7 22. Ref3 Nd8 23. Qe4: ! As well preventing e6 Queen now has access to H file
moves.23... g6 24. Qh4 Rg8: If black takes rook, Qf6+, Kg8, Rg3#
moves.25. Rf5xf7: Black resigns with mate looming. Sharp & powerful game for white.
